randoop.util

Class Reflection

  • Object
    • Reflection

  • public final class Reflection
extends Object
    Utility methods that operate on reflection objects (classes, methods, etc.).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Reflection.Match
      Used by methods that that a java.lang.Class<?> object as argument and use it to compute something based on it.

    • Method Detail

      • relatedClasses

        public static Set<Class<?>> relatedClasses(Class<?> clazz,
                                           int depth)
        Returns the set of classes that appear, recursively, in the interface of the given class, to a given depth. For example, if class C1 declares only method foo(C2)/C3, and class C2 declares method bar(C4)/C5, then: We say that C1, C2 and C3 are related to C1 at depth ≥ 0. We say that C4 and C5 are related to C1 at depth ≥ 1. We say that a class C2 appears in the interface of C iff: (1) C2 is C (2) C2 is a return value of some method in C.getMethods() (2) C2 is a parameter of some method in C.getMethods() or some constructor in C.getConstructors().

      • relatedClasses

        public static Set<Class<?>> relatedClasses(Collection<Class<?>> classes,
                                           int i)

      • getMethodsOrdered

        public static Method[] getMethodsOrdered(Class<?> c)
        Like Class.getMethods(), but guarantees always same order.

      • classForName

        public static Class<?> classForName(String classname)
        Gets the class corresponding to the given string. Assumes the string is in the format output by the method java.lang.Class.toString().

      • classForName

        public static Class<?> classForName(String classname,
                                    boolean noerr)
        Gets the class corresponding to the given string. Assumes the string is in the format output by the method java.lang.Class.toString(). If noerr==true and Class.forName(classname) throws an exception, throws an Error. If noerr==false and Class.forName(classname) throws an exception, returns null.

      • getDirectSuperTypes

        public static Set<Class<?>> getDirectSuperTypes(Class<?> c)

      • canBeUsedAs

        public static boolean canBeUsedAs(Class<?> c1,
                                  Class<?> c2)
        Checks if an object of class c1 can be used as an object of class c2. This is more than subtyping: for example, int can be used as Integer, but the latter is not a subtype of the former.

      • checkArgumentTypes

        public static String checkArgumentTypes(Object[] inputs,
                                        Class<?>[] paramTypes,
                                        Object errMsgContext)
        Checks whether the inputs can be used as arguments for the specified parameter types. This method considers "null" as always being a valid argument. errMsgContext is uninterpreted - just printed in error messages Returns null if inputs are OK wrt paramTypes. Returns error message otherwise.

      • canBePassedAsArgument

        public static boolean canBePassedAsArgument(Object inputObject,
                                            Class<?> parameterType)
        Returns whether the input can be used as argument for the specified parameter type.

      • loadClassesFromList

        public static List<Class<?>> loadClassesFromList(List<String> classNames,
                                                 boolean noerr)
        Returns a list of classes, given a list of class names. if noerr=true, any classnames where Class.forName(classname) are ignored and not added to the list. Otherwise, an exception is thrown in this situation.

      • loadClassesFromStream

        public static List<Class<?>> loadClassesFromStream(InputStream in,
                                                   String filename)
        Blank lines and lines starting with "#" are ignored. Other lines must contain string such that Class.forName(s) returns a class.
